main event: An unidentified flying object was observed in Casper, Wyoming on March 23, 1953, described as a bright orange disk that appeared to move rapidly and behaved unusually.
interesting points: The object was observed by three civilian witnesses at Natrona County Airport., The object emitted no sound and left no trail during its flight., Witnesses reported that the object moved in a zig zag pattern before disappearing., The sighting lasted approximately 2-3 minutes., The object is concluded to potentially be a balloon, based on its description.
witness description: civilians who reported the sighting, including college graduates with military experience.
